input.name: __VIEWSTATE

span.p: Loveland school buildings are closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. To learn more about the coronavirus situation, click here.

li.a: Loveland Educating Against Alcohol and Drugs (LEAAD)
Free and Reduced Meal Online Application

p.style: color: #EF5322; font-size: 20px; padding-left: 19px; margin-bottom: -2px; font-weight: bold;

li.a: Loveland Educating Against Alcohol and Drugs (LEAAD)
Free and Reduced Meal Online Application
Who to contact during the school building closure

td.a: Who to contact during the school building closure

span.div: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is responding to an outbreak of respiratory disease caused by a new coronavirus that was first detected in China, but now has spread to countries across the world, including the United States. According to the CDC, the virus has been named SARS-CoV-2, and the disease it causes is called Coronavirus Disease 2019, which is abbreviated “COVID-19.” On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) started characterizing COVID-19 as a “pandemic,” which means that a disease epidemic has spread across a large region of the world.

div.br: The Loveland City School District works with other government entities in our area to monitor and coordinate efforts in regards to any situation that could potentially pose a threat to the health, safety or welfare of our community. We monitor the situation through constant communications with county and state health partners as well as updates from the CDC. Loveland Schools along with a long list of others organizations have come together to mitigate the negative impact on the community from the health crisis. A hotline (513) 781-6345 is staffed by volunteers from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m., seven days a week. You can also email [email protected]. Visit the Loveland Community Resources website for more information and to learn how residents in the Loveland area can receive help at this time.

It is important for the district to be part of the greater efforts to limit the spread of the virus in our community as a whole, and for that reason, we are following the guidelines as they are released by state health officials and the Ohio governor. The guidance changes rapidly and we encourage you to visit this page and other resources listed here frequently to stay on top of the situation and keep yourself informed about the measures you can take to stay healthy.

div.span: For specific questions regarding illness of your child or family member, please contact the nurses and health aides in your child’s building.
